input: question: Many researchers prefer what term? [SEP] sentence: In 2003, the ICZN ruled in its Opinion 2027 that if wild animals and their domesticated derivatives are regarded as one species, then the scientific name of that species is the scientific name of the wild animal.
question: Under who's rule did Alsace thrive under? [SEP] sentence: The idea was that such men would be more tractable and less likely to alienate the fief from the crown out of their own greed.
question: When did Madonna adopt David Banda? [SEP] sentence: While there, she decided to adopt a boy named David Banda in October 2006.

question: What does Firefox's version for Windows 8 do? [SEP] sentence: The developers of both Chrome and Firefox committed to developing Metro-style versions of their browsers; while Chrome's "Windows 8 mode" uses a full-screen version of the existing desktop interface, Firefox's version (which was first made available on the "Aurora" release channel in September 2013) uses a touch-optimized interface inspired by the Android version of Firefox.

question: How much had the book earned Darwin by the time he died? [SEP] sentence: (eventually Murray paid £180 to Darwin for the 1st edition and by Darwin's death in 1882 the book was in its 6th edition, earning Darwin nearly £3000.)

question: Which of Popper's works responds to critiques of naive falsificationism? [SEP] sentence: The Quine-Duhem thesis argues that it's impossible to test a single hypothesis on its own, since each one comes as part of an environment of theories.

question: Who ordered the construction of the church? [SEP] sentence: According to a tradition first reported by Sulcard in about 1080, a church was founded at the site (then known as Thorn Ey (Thorn Island)) in the 7th century, at the time of Mellitus, a Bishop of London.

question: What are the remaining Cetic languages that are still used today? [SEP] sentence: The Insular Celtic languages of the Goidelic sub-group (Irish, Manx and Scottish Gaelic) and the Brittonic sub-group (Cornish, Welsh and Breton, spoken in north-western France) are the only remaining Celtic languages—the last of their continental relations becoming extinct before the 7th century.
question: Which Hawaiin volcano has been erupting since 1983? [SEP] sentence: There has not been a major life-threatening eruption on the Hawaiian islands since the 17th century.

question: What did the foundation decide in 2009 [SEP] sentence: This was because the sanitation sector was generally receiving less attention from other donors and from governments, and because the Foundation believed it had the potential to make a real difference through strategic investments.

question: What ranking in the country does Greater Boston metro hold as far as economy? [SEP] sentence: Encompassing $363 billion, the Greater Boston metropolitan area has the sixth-largest economy in the country and 12th-largest in the world.

question: What could be coupled with an antenna to form pure resistance? [SEP] sentence: By adding an inductance in series with the antenna, a so-called loading coil, the capacitive reactance of this antenna can be cancelled leaving a pure resistance which can then be matched to the transmission line.

question: What rank is Oklahoma Cities television networks for Nielsen? [SEP] sentence: The major U.S. broadcast television networks have affiliates in the Oklahoma City market (ranked 41st for television by Nielsen and 48th for radio by Arbitron, covering a 34-county area serving the central, northern-central and west-central sections Oklahoma); including NBC affiliate KFOR-TV (channel 4), ABC affiliate KOCO-TV (channel 5), CBS affiliate KWTV-DT (channel 9, the flagship of locally based Griffin Communications), PBS station KETA-TV (channel 13, the flagship of the state-run OETA member network), Fox affiliate KOKH-TV (channel 25), CW affiliate KOCB (channel 34)

question: What percentage of Estonian Russians have though of going back to Russia? [SEP] sentence: According to surveys, only 5% of the Russian community have considered returning to Russia in the near future.

question: What company was previously headquartered in the Downtown Macy's? [SEP] sentence: The corner of Flagler Street and Miami Avenue is in the middle of Downtown in front of the Downtown Macy's (formerly the Burdine's headquarters).
question: What are cytokinins responsible for in plants? [SEP] sentence: Cytokinins are a class of plant hormones named for their control of cell division or cytokinesis.
